Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been okay. I made an effort to spend time with my granddaughter, and it was nice.
That’s wonderful to hear! What did you do together?
We went to the zoo, and she loved it. It was fun to see her excitement.
That sounds like a fantastic experience! How did you feel during and after the visit?
I felt really happy. It was a nice distraction from everything else.
That’s great! It’s important to have those moments of joy. Have you been able to incorporate any self-care activities, like reading or watching movies?
Yes! I set aside some time last weekend to watch a movie, and it felt good to relax.
That’s fantastic! It’s great to hear you’re making time for yourself. How did that impact your mood?
I felt lighter afterward. It was nice to escape into a different world for a bit.
That’s the power of self-care. It can help recharge your emotional batteries. Have you continued practicing any mindfulness techniques?
I tried it a few more times, and it’s getting easier to focus.
That’s excellent progress! Remember, it’s all about practice. Is there anything that still feels challenging?
I still struggle with sleep. I wake up a lot, and it’s frustrating.
Sleep can be tricky, especially when there’s a lot on your mind. Have you tried any new strategies for improving your sleep?
I’ve been trying to limit screen time before bed, but it’s hard to stick to.
That’s a great step! It can also help to establish a calming bedtime routine. Would you like to brainstorm some ideas together?
Sure! What do you suggest?
You could try reading a book, listening to calming music, or even doing some gentle stretches before bed.
Those sound good. I like the idea of stretching.
Great! Stretching can help release tension in your body. Would you like to commit to trying that this week?
Yes, I can do that.
Wonderful! Let’s check in on your feelings regarding your daughter. How has that been since our last talk?
I finally talked to her about my feelings. She was really understanding.
That’s a big step! How did it feel to share your feelings with her?
It felt relieving. I think it helped strengthen our connection.
That’s fantastic! Communication can really make a difference in relationships. Have you noticed any changes in how you both interact since then?
Yes, we’ve been more open with each other. It feels good.
I’m so happy to hear that. Building that trust is essential. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I think I want to focus on my feelings of depression. Sometimes I feel overwhelmed.
That’s valid. It’s important to acknowledge those feelings. What do you think triggers those feelings of overwhelm?
I think it’s a mix of worrying about my daughter and feeling stuck in my own life.
That makes sense. It’s tough to carry both of those burdens. Have you found any coping mechanisms that help when you start feeling overwhelmed?
Sometimes talking to friends helps, but I haven’t done that much lately.
Reaching out to friends can be really beneficial. Would you like to set a goal to connect with a friend this week?
Yes, I think that would help.
Great! It could be a simple phone call or even a coffee date. Just something to connect with someone who supports you.
I’ll try to do that.
Excellent! Remember, you’re not alone in this. You have support around you.
Thank you for reminding me.

You’re welcome. I think we’ve made some great progress today. Let’s recap: you’ll practice mindfulness, incorporate stretching into your bedtime routine, spend time with your granddaughter, and reach out to a friend.
Sounds good to me!
I’m excited to hear about your experiences in our next session. Take care of yourself!
Bye, Ellie!
Bye!
